alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 2:35PM EST until December 18 at 6:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...1 to locally 2 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline with the Monday afternoon high tide. Less than 1 ft inundation above ground level is possible with tonight`s high tide. * WHERE...Bronx, Northwest Suffolk, Northern Queens and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 6 PM EST Monday. Localized minor flooding possible with tonight`s high tide. Widespread minor to moderate flooding likely with the Monday afternoon high tide. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Widespread minor to locally moderate flooding (1 to locally 2 ft of inundation) of vulnerable areas is likely near the waterfront and shoreline, including roads, parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront. Scattered road closures are possible, and vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront may become flooded. Flooding may also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy rainfall and/or runoff coinciding with tonight and Monday afternoon`s high tides will exacerbate street and property flooding issues along the coast and tidally affected rivers and streams. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. LITTLE NECK BAY AT KINGS POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 10.0 FT, MODERATE 10.5 FT, MAJOR 13.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.2 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 5.2 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/02 PM 9.2/ 9.7 1.4/ 1.9 1.3/ 1.8 1 NONE 18/03 AM 9.5/10.0 1.7/ 2.2 2.2/ 2.7 2-4 NONE 18/03 PM 10.4/10.9 2.6/ 3.1 2.8/ 3.4 1-3 MIN-MOD 19/04 AM 6.5/ 7.0 -1.4/-0.9 -0.9/-0.4 1 NONE 19/04 PM 7.4/ 7.9 -0.5/ 0.0 0.2/ 0.7 1 NONE 20/05 AM 7.7/ 8.2 -0.2/ 0.3 0.2/ 0.7 1 NONE FLAX POND AT OLD FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.2 FT, MODERATE 10.2 FT, MAJOR 12.2 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 4.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/02 PM 8.3/ 8.8 1.0/ 1.5 1.2/ 1.7 1 NONE 18/03 AM 8.7/ 9.2 1.4/ 1.9 2.0/ 2.5 2-3 NONE 18/03 PM 9.6/10.1 2.2/ 2.7 2.7/ 3.2 2-3 MINOR 19/04 AM 6.0/ 6.5 -1.4/-0.9 -0.9/-0.4 1 NONE 19/04 PM 6.7/ 7.2 -0.7/-0.2 0.2/ 0.7 1 NONE 20/05 AM 6.9/ 7.4 -0.5/ 0.0 0.0/ 0.5 2 NONE WEST POND AT GLEN COVE NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 10.1 FT, MODERATE 11.1 FT, MAJOR 13.1 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.2 FT, MODERATE 3.2 FT, MAJOR 5.2 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 17/02 PM 9.1/ 9.6 1.2/ 1.7 1.1/ 1.6 0 NONE 18/03 AM 9.3/ 9.8 1.4/ 1.9 1.6/ 2.0 0 NONE 18/03 PM 10.5/11.0 2.6/ 3.1 2.8/ 3.4 0 MINOR 19/04 AM 7.1/ 7.6 -0.9/-0.4 -0.8/-0.2 0-1 NONE 19/05 PM 7.6/ 8.1 -0.3/ 0.2 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE 20/05 AM 8.0/ 8.5 0.1/ 0.6 0.2/ 0.7 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
